A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
I really liked this movie -- and yes\, I love star wars a lot. I managed to avoid all spoilers in the movie by not reading any reviews\, so that I may be able to see it with an unbiased review. After seeing it and reading several of the reviews\, I can honesty say some of the fans who reviewed it are full of it. 

The Good: The movie went at a decent pace. the story was entertaining\, had a lot of awesome action sequences\, pretty good character development\, and wasn't too long.The movie itself was well done - the graphics were good\, the music was great (gotta love john williams!). I liked the costume design as well. I actually thought the humor was appropriate and well placed. it's OK to not have a movie that is 100% serious. Some people don't like the "marvel-esque" humor\, but I thought it was MUCH better compared to marvel. Also\, do people not remember how campy and corny the old movies were?? I guess so. 

The "bad": I put bad in quotes\, because there's not a whole lot that is actually bad. I think they had a chance to really develop Captain Phasma\, but\, it's fine. not the end of the world. I also think they should have had done a little more with Snoke. i glad he met his end at the hand of a certain main character\, but it would have been awesome to see a good fight. There were a few plot holes (I wish we could have seen a little more of Luke when he was a teacher\, but again\, not the end of the world.) It seems that people are upset with plot holes. they CAN be cleared up in other movies. I think Rose's character would have been more meaningful if she were introduced in the last movie. I'm unsure if I want to see a love story between Rose and Finn. seems...pointless. That said\, I LOVE the genuine love/best friendship between Finn and Rey. I hope to see more of that in the next movie.

So overall\, I felt it was an entertaining movie and I cant wait to see the next movies.
